meaning: One who purchases.
A small bag for carrying money.
The person responsible for handling the accounts on a ship, or for dealing with the passengers on a ship or aircraft.
Anything that is difficult to understand or make sense of.
example: Where he went after he left the house is a puzzle.

meaning: A periodical publication that appears four times per year.
example: quarterly rent payments

meaning: A question, an inquiry (US), an enquiry (UK).
example: The teacher answered the student’s query concerning biosynthesis.

meaning: A form containing a list of questions; a means of gathering information for a survey
To pay (a debt, fine etc.).
example: After having to work overtime without being paid, I quit my job.

meaning: A series of one or more shelves, stacked one above the other
example: I bought a rack of lamb at the butcher's yesterday.

meaning: A transport system using rails used to move passengers or goods.
A waterproof coat to be worn in the rain.
The amount of rain that falls on a single occasion
Pouring with rain; wet; showery
example: Due to the rainy weather, we decided not to play in the park.

meaning: A beam of light or radiation.
example: I saw a ray of light through the clouds.

meaning: Expressed or represented as being accurate, practicable, or not idealistic.
example: A realistic appraisal of the situation.

meaning: A person or business that sells or leases out real estate, acting as an agent for the property owner.
To change the order or arrangement of (one or more items).
To assure anew; to restore confidence to; to free from fear or self-doubt.
example: The boy's mother reassured him that there was no monster hiding under the bed.

meaning: A deduction from an amount that is paid; an abatement.
The act of receiving, or the fact of having been received.
example: A balance payable on receipt of the goods.

meaning: The act of receiving.
example: The new system provides exceptional quality of the reception signal.

meaning: An employee (such as a secretary) who works in reception (receiving visitors and/or calls) for a person or business, especially an office.
The act or an instance of receding or withdrawing.
A formula for preparing or using a medicine; a prescription; also, a medicine prepared from such instructions.
example: His new approach is definitely a recipe for success.

meaning: One who receives.
example: My e-mail never reached the intended recipient.

meaning: To consider a matter again
example: Is there any way I can get you to reconsider selling your car?

meaning: Any activity, such as play, that amuses, diverts or stimulates.
For, or relating to, recreation.
Agent noun of recruit; one who recruits, particularly one employed to recruit others.
example: The army recruiter promised that I'd see the world and learn useful skills if I enlisted.

meaning: The process or art of finding candidates for a post in an organization, or recruits for the armed forces.
To have recourse (to) someone or something for assistance, support etc.
example: The theme of the prodigal son recurs later in the third act.

meaning: An act of recycling.
example: Both paper and plastic can be recycled.

meaning: To change the appearance of a place by altering the decor.

A plan for making changes to the structure and functions of an artifact, building or system so as to better serve the purpose of the original design, or to serve purposes different from those set forth in the original design.
An umpire or judge; an official who makes sure the rules are followed during a game.
example: The referee kicked Jim out of the game for fighting.

meaning: The act or process of transferring someone or something to another, of sending by reference, or referring.
example: The insurance company insists I get a referral from my regular doctor. I can't just go to the specialist; a GP has got to refer me.

meaning: A building, or a mass of machinery, used to produce refined products such as sugar, oil, or metals.
That reflects, or redirects back to the source.
example: Mirrors are reflective.

meaning: The periodic energizing required to maintain the contents of computer memory, the display luminance of a computer screen, etc.
example: Sleep refreshes the body and the mind.

meaning: The action of refreshing; a means of restoring strength, energy or vigour.
A household appliance used for keeping food fresh by refrigeration (short form fridge).
An amount of money returned.
example: If the camera is faulty, you can return it to the store where you bought it for a full refund.
